name: Butterfly Pea Plant
climate: Thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with warm temperatures.
Can also be grown in temperate climates during the summer months.
Highly tolerant to heat and can survive in environments with high humidity.
Not suited for cold climates and should be protected from frost.
sunlight: Requires full sunlight exposure for optimal growth and flowering.
Can tolerate partial shade but may lead to reduced flowering performance.
In areas with intense sunlight, some afternoon shade might be beneficial.
Ensuring at least 6-8 hours of direct sunlight daily will promote growth.
watering: Needs regular watering to keep the soil adequately moist, especially in dry periods.
Overwatering should be avoided as it can lead to root rot and plant diseases.
A deep watering once a week during dry seasons is generally sufficient.
During the growing season, increase watering frequency to support plant growth.
soil: Prefers well-drained, rich, and loamy soil to facilitate root growth.
Will tolerate a range of soil types but thrives in fertile, organic-rich mediums.
Adding compost or organic matter can enhance soil quality and fertility.
Avoid heavy clay soils which may retain too much moisture, harming the roots.
